when copied manually from debian
source all were ok
Versions of packages gnome-osd depends on:

ii  gconf2                        2.14.0-4   GNOME configuration database syste
ii  python                        2.3.5-11   An interactive high-level object-o
ii  python-gnome2 [python2.4-gnom 2.12.4-4   Python bindings for the GNOME desk
ii  python-gtk2 [python2.4-gtk2]  2.8.6-5    Python bindings for the GTK+ widge
ii  python-pyorbit-omg [python2.4 2.0.1-5    PyORBit - python CORBA OMG standar
ii  python-support                0.4.1      automated rebuilding support for p
ii  python2.4                     2.4.3-8    An interactive high-level object-o
ii  python2.4-dbus                0.62-4     simple interprocess messaging syst
Why do you consider this package unusable?

I'm testing it and it seems to work 
fine.

Please notice that the directory that you mention is not needed in the actual 
version, and I believe it's a bug: the directory should not be in the 
package.

In Debian, the python modules are now managed by the python-support package, 
you can see the python files of this particular package

in /usr/share/python-support/gnome-osd, and the compiled version of those 
in /var/lib/python-support/python2.4.
> Why do you consider this package unusable?

I'm testing it and it seems
> to work fine.
I'm not so experienced on python.
it could be interesting to have a 'python2.3' version, I copied manually

> Please notice that the directory that you mention is not needed in the actual 
> version, and I believe it's a bug: the directory should not be in the 
> package.

> In Debian, the python modules are now managed by the python-support package, 
> you can see the python files of this particular package

> in /usr/share/python-support/gnome-osd, and the compiled version of those 
> in /var/lib/python-support/python2.4.
On Sat, 2006-08-19 at 22:40 +0200, Marco Milanesi wrote:
> as the subject says, files are missing.

when copied manually from debian
> source all were ok

As Maximiliano Curia already mentioned the
package complies (more or less) to the new python policy which is why
there are no files in /usr/lib/python2.4/site-packages/gnomeosd.
I am unable to confirm the creation of the that directory though.

It is
not included in the package, nor created at installation time.

Did you create this directory manually or was it a leftover from a
previous version of gnome-osd?
> > as the subject says, files are missing.

when copied manually from debian
> > source all were ok

       python2.4-gtk2
